title: What process could cause a decrease in KE

content.question: While the object is continuously oscillating, the student determines the maximum speed of the object during two oscillations. The first speed is 3.5 m / s and the second speed is 2.7 m / s. Which of the following could account for the decrease in the objectâ€™s maximum kinetic energy?

choices.label: Energy was transferred from the object to the spring, which increased the maximum potential energy of the spring.
Energy was transferred from the spring to the object, which decreased the maximum potential energy of the spring.
As energy was transferred back and forth between the object and the spring, a greater average share of the energy became potential energy of the spring.
The object-spring system lost energy to its surroundings.

content.answer: The object-spring system lost energy to its surroundings.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
